meanings.definition: Relating to or characteristic of subjectivism.
meanings.sent1: Her subjectivistic approach to art focused on personal emotions and experiences.
meanings.sent2: The artist's subjectivistic style resonated with viewers who appreciated emotional depth.
meanings.sent3: She took a subjectivistic view of the painting, seeing it as a reflection of her own thoughts.
meanings.sent4: His subjectivistic interpretation of the novel brought out hidden layers of meaning.
meanings.sent5: The subjectivistic nature of the poem allowed readers to connect on a personal level.

meanings.definition: Inclined to emphasize subjective elements or personal feelings in interpretation.
meanings.sent1: The critic's subjectivistic reviews often sparked debates among readers.
meanings.sent2: She had a subjectivistic view of history, focusing on individual experiences rather than facts.
meanings.sent3: His subjectivistic analysis of the movie made everyone laugh at his unique perspective.
meanings.sent4: The subjectivistic lens through which she viewed the world colored her interactions with others.
meanings.sent5: The subjectivistic approach to decision-making prioritized personal feelings over objective reasoning.
